rename.from: With `compilerOptions: { runes: true }`, `root.svelte` file generate `` `<svelte:component>` is deprecated in runes mode — components are dynamic by default``
rename.to: With `compilerOptions: { runes: true }`, `root.svelte` file generate `<svelte:component>` is deprecated in runes mode — components are dynamic by default

body:
@Rich-Harris Right now, we're emitting code like `<svelte:component this={constructors[0]} ...>` - What do you think about also recognizing things of the form `<foo[bar]>` as always being components? Or is that too niche, and we should just have a sequence of `{@const}`s at different levels of `{#if}`s?

As a side note, if we're going to be refactoring this generated component, maybe we should also switch away from the name `constructors` in Svelte 5, for clarity.
The same message / warning is gerenrated even without opting into the runes mode with this `compilerOptions: { runes: true }` as it probably auto-detects runes mode.

The code that generates this file (https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/blob/main/packages/kit/src/core/sync/write_root.js) detects the presence of Svelte 5 and uses that, not the compiler option, to decide what to write. The generated file actually forces runes mode on at the component level with `<svelte:options>`.

rename.from: With `compilerOptions: { runes: true }`, `root.svelte` file generate `<svelte:component>` is deprecated in runes mode — components are dynamic by default
rename.to: Svelte 5: `root.svelte` file generate `<svelte:component>` is deprecated in runes mode — components are dynamic by default

body:
> @Rich-Harris Right now, we're emitting code like `<svelte:component this={constructors[0]} ...>` - What do you think about also recognizing things of the form `<foo[bar]>` as always being components? Or is that too niche, and we should just have a sequence of `{@const}`s at different levels of `{#if}`s?

Tbf i think the same assumptions made for `component.thing` could be made for `component[thing]`...my only fear is that this opens the door to some weird things like various directives that allow things like `use:foo[bar].thing[0]` and it's a mess to parse right.

Oh just realised that we already allow that for uppercase components...i guess it make sense to allow lowercase components too

https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAE32P3QqCQBBGX2UYuihYtGu1wO0xXC9Ex1pwf9gdgxDfPSzCIvBiYObjHJhvwl4PFDGrJrSNIcyw9B4F8sMvR7zTwIQCoxtDuyRFbIP2fFZWsTbeBYYS-uAMKEzSMnkbCvMvQK6A_AWWGYjh4ox3lixHOMEucsO0rya-aXvNoJwFfHY514dc2SJd37DFalfHOnmRkJ5RoHGd7jV1mHEYaRZrya2KzZYpt0z5b9bzE2jdl89kAQAA

issue.title: feat: error on invalid component name

repository.name: svelte
repository.description: web development for the rest of us

issue.body:
## Svelte 5 rewrite

Cheap follow up to #12798 that i've quickly implemented after a brief discussion on https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/12573#issuecomment-2284651289

Given it's already allowed for uppercase components i think it makes sense to also allow tags like `arr[0]`. If we actually don't want this feel free to close it didn't take me much.

Please note that [the Svelte codebase is currently being rewritten for Svelte 5](https://svelte.dev/blog/runes). Changes should target Svelte 5, which lives on the default branch (`main`).

If your PR concerns Svelte 4 (including updates to [svelte.dev.docs](https://svelte.dev/docs)), please ensure the base branch is `svelte-4` and not `main`.

### Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following

- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] Prefix your PR title with `feat:`, `fix:`, `chore:`, or `docs:`.
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [x] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests and linting

- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint`

body: If we end up going with https://github.com/sveltejs/svelte/pull/12821, then no, I don't think it's worth it. If we don't go with that change and we're going to need to do a bit of refactoring of this component anyway, then possibly.
Huh, didn't realize the array notation thing already works. That skeeves me out a bit tbh, it makes it look like you can use arbitrary expressions

> Huh, didn't realize the array notation thing already works. That skeeves me out a bit tbh, it makes it look like you can use arbitrary expressions

Tbf i think you actually can...once something is [recognized as a component it just use that thing as a function call](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAE32PywqDMBREfyVcumghVdfRCqGfkWRh9QoB8yC5CiL-e5EuLBS6nGHOwNlgtBNmEGoD3zkEATJG4EBrPEJecCIEDjnMqT-aJvfJRmq112RdDImYZGMKjmkoSll8CA31MZiQ2DO4GDx6yuzBLpk6wqvaNCyY1vurGzQIpqTZza3WvinPe9-cqKqM-kaMqgwrW-DgwmBHiwMISjPu_PT4ZyF_SbO_AaOKkmUNAQAA)

It breaks down [when using variables tho](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAE32R0W6DMAxFf8Wy9tBKrPSZAhPsM5I8UAgjakhQYjpViH-fKOsATeLJsn3u9ZU8YK209BixAU3RSoww6zoMkB7d1Pi71CQxQG97V06T2JdOdZRyw0m1nXUEGdTOtsDxFGanWcHxsgLyBcg3gOGkJcF3o8oGEnjzVJA8cLxL93i_FhXH49PnBX7atrNGGvILzYY1HwHLRAAcPSmt_2a5GMVkFYdLfBMvduws2DOFYGcB4by-9kTWgDWlVuUtGQ7HJB2mKK-8vzVJYB0BPrbnIdqsL9yMY1o2hfmScTjfSDHA1laqVrLCiFwvx2B5yN47sj1lvqfM_yvF-AMaLpbNEAIAAA==) (surprisingly it actually worked until i wrote the code for the button since at the point `which` become a source and it's not `$.get` in the component.

No, you can't. It just [puts the expression in verbatim](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAA32QzWrDMBCEX2VZCkmoieqrYxtCHsP2wchrLJBWQlr3B-N3L3bS5lJ6nN1vhmEWHI2lhEWzIPeOsMBrCJihfIVNpHeyQphh8nPU26VMOpogdcutGBd8FLhNxg4wRu_gcFa7Ot-Nh0vLG6g9J4Gbd8EzsSSooNm57gFYEjA80CdU8JKkFzq-nR6_cWYtxjMY1pEcsRxPsGyfVu6e1wryCygFyYNM_U-USbBHbejacqme1bl8lml2ugNVY4bOD2Y0NGAhcaY1-51lr_vvMFNeT2Sthw8f7VCqKf8jsFu_AWGQOBNzAQAA) without processing it. This is a bug and we should fix it

> No, you can't. It just [puts the expression in verbatim](https://svelte-5-preview.vercel.app/#H4sIAAAAAAAAA32QzWrDMBCEX2VZCkmoieqrYxtCHsP2wchrLJBWQlr3B-N3L3bS5lJ6nN1vhmEWHI2lhEWzIPeOsMBrCJihfIVNpHeyQphh8nPU26VMOpogdcutGBd8FLhNxg4wRu_gcFa7Ot-Nh0vLG6g9J4Gbd8EzsSSooNm57gFYEjA80CdU8JKkFzq-nR6_cWYtxjMY1pEcsRxPsGyfVu6e1wryCygFyYNM_U-USbBHbejacqme1bl8lml2ugNVY4bOD2Y0NGAhcaY1-51lr_vvMFNeT2Sthw8f7VCqKf8jsFu_AWGQOBNzAQAA) without processing it. This is a bug and we should fix it

Yeah see my following comment...by fix it i guess you mean make it work right? 😄

issue.title: fix: use dynamic components in `root.svelte` instead of `svelte:component` for svelte 5
issue.body:
Closes #12573

Again i'm not really sure if and where i should add a test for this. Also for the moment i did not rename `constructors` to something else in svelte 5 because there was still the possibility to share some code but i'm willing to completely split the two branches if we feel like.

### Please don't delete this checklist! Before submitting the PR, please make sure you do the following:
- [x] It's really useful if your PR references an issue where it is discussed ahead of time. In many cases, features are absent for a reason. For large changes, please create an RFC: https://github.com/sveltejs/rfcs
- [x] This message body should clearly illustrate what problems it solves.
- [ ] Ideally, include a test that fails without this PR but passes with it.

### Tests
- [x] Run the tests with `pnpm test` and lint the project with `pnpm lint` and `pnpm check`

### Changesets
- [x] If your PR makes a change that should be noted in one or more packages' changelogs, generate a changeset by running `pnpm changeset` and following the prompts. Changesets that add features should be `minor` and those that fix bugs should be `patch`. Please prefix changeset messages with `feat:`, `fix:`, or `chore:`.

### Edits

- [x] Please ensure that 'Allow edits from maintainers' is checked. PRs without this option may be closed.
